Weapon, uncommon

Martial weapon, melee weapon 4 lb.
[[/r 1d8]] slashing - versatile ([[/r 1d10]])

The Frozen Forge is the site of frost giants' cold forging secrets, a manufactory in the heart of a frigid volcano. As they hammer these ingots, they sing the Song of Steel, an ancient melody that prevents the cold, brittle metal from shearing beneath their mighty blows. By pressing the rune-engraved metal into one's skin, one creates a nigh-unbreakable bond with the Frozen Forge.

This axe has 4 charges and regains [[/r 1d4]] expended charges after it spends 8 continuous hours in snow, ice, or cold water. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to cause cold mist to emanate from the axe for 10 minutes. It glows a soft blue, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and deals an extra [[/r 1d6]] cold damage on a hit.

Enhanced Attunement: Brand. Over the course of an hour, you can undergo a branding ritual to become bonded to the axe, gaining access to the Razorice property. In addition, when the weapon regains charges, it regains all expended charges. Once you have undergone this branding ritual, you can't willingly end your attunement to the axe until another creature willingly undertakes the branding ritual, at which point it becomes attuned to the axe instead.

EA: Razorice. As an action, you can expend 2 charges to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.9gYGkrL6qFTsE6fw]{Spike Growth} spell (save DC 13), creating spikes of razor-sharp icicles.

Versatile. This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Weapon, rare (requires attunement)

Martial weapon, ranged weapon 3 lb.
[[/r 1d6]] piercing - ammunition (30/60 ft.), Reload (2)

Woven from the first branches to bloom at the end of winter, this living bow is strung with a length of snowspider's silk.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While holding this bow, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.SbSvZKkJASyk8jKo]{Druidcraft} cantrip. In addition, when an arrow is nocked on this bow, the arrow immediately lights up, emanating blue mist and shedding bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. This light lasts for 1 minute after the arrow is shot from the bow.

Winter Hunt. This weapon deals an extra [[/r 1d6]] cold damage to each creature it hits that is in freezing temperatures or is standing on snow or ice.

Ice Shower. As an action, you can choose a point you can see within the normal range of this weapon and fire a volley of up to 6 arrows. These arrows levitate in the air when they enter a 15-foot radius centred on that point. For 1 minute, or until all the arrows are used, whenever a creature other than you enters the area for the first time on its turn or starts its turn there, one arrow shoots at it. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take [[/r 1d6]] piercing damage and [[/r 1d6]] cold damage. Once this property of the bow has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Tommybows are repeating crossbows that mirror the three types of normal crossbows: hand, heavy, and light. They are composed of vertically-stacked bows upon a crossbow's chassis, an unwieldy arrangement that reduces their effective range in comparison to their crossbow counterparts.

Tommybows replace the loading property of their crossbow counterpart with the reload property. The cost of the item is proportional to the amount of ammunition it can hold (the value in parentheses), with the maximum reload (6) tommybow costing six times its crossbow counterpart's price.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

Andvaranaut (Common).description:
Ring, common

Glowing with tiny motes of pulsing light, this brilliant golden ring is inscribed with runes of wealth and prosperity. Two legends follow this ring. The first tells of humble folk using the ring to lead modest lives free from discomfort and hardship. The second tells of mighty leaders brought low by their own greed. Which is true—if either—is anyone's guess.

Andvari's Gift. As a bonus action, you can speak the ring's command word—"plunder"—to form a trail of softly glowing golden dust that leads to the nearest source of gold worth at least 5 gp that isn't currently carried or worn by a creature within 100 feet of you. The trail can't pass through solid objects but will navigate through holes as small as 1 inch in diameter. If all paths to the gold source are blocked by solid objects, the trail ends as close to the gold as possible. The trail disappears immediately if the gold source is destroyed, transported to another plane, or picked up by a creature.Once this property has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

When the mighty wolf Fenrir threatened the world, the dwarves fashioned an impossibly strong thread with which to keep him bound. This thread, known as Gleipnir, was crafted from the sound of a cat's footfall, the roots of a mountain, and the breath of a fish, amongst other things. With the leftover material, the Weapons of Binding were made. The suneater axe is one such weapon, a depiction of the wolf Sköll, who the dwarves believe will one day devour the sun.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The axe has 6 charges and regains [[/r 1d6]] expended charges daily at dawn.

Suneater. As an action, you can expend 2 charges to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness} spell. When you cast the spell in this way, you can choose to spend 1 additional charge. If you do, you can see through the magical darkness of the spell while holding the suneater axe.

Gleipnir. When you make an attack with this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to launch the axe's blade from the wolf's mouth, attached to the weapon by a long thread. Instead of a melee weapon attack, make a ranged weapon attack against a target within 30 feet of you, using your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects and it must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or become grappled (escape DC 15) as the thread wraps itself around it. A creature that fails this saving throw by 5 or more is restrained while it is grappled in this way. Huge or larger creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw. The grappled creature or a creature within reach of it can attempt a DC 15 Strength check, ending the grapple on a success. The grapple also ends if you pull the axe's blade back towards the weapon (no action required) or if you let go of the axe. While you have a creature grappled in this way, you can't attack with the suneater axe. As a bonus action, you can try to reel the creature in, making a Strength (Athletics) check, contested by one from the grappled creature. On a success, you pull the target up to 15 feet towards you.

The grapple also ends if you pull the axe's blade back towards the weapon (no action required) or if you let go of the axe. While you have a creature grappled in this way, you can't attack with the suneater axe. As a bonus action, you can try to reel the creature in, making a Strength (Athletics) check, contested by one from the grappled creature. On a success, you pull the target up to 15 feet towards you.

Isfjell, Ring of Icebergs (Legendary).name: Isfjell, Ring of Icebergs (Legendary)
Isfjell, Ring of Icebergs (Legendary).description:
Ring, legendary (attunement optional)

Crafted in the Frozen Forge, this ring is capable of entombing its wearer in a protective iceberg, or isfjell as it is known in the Giant tongue. Such rings are found in all sizes; a ring crafted for a giant might be worn as a torc by Loic Giantslayer, or as a belt by Mitji the Tiny. This malleability arises thanks to the wisps of water vapour that run between the ring's jagged ends and its geodesic jewel.

You gain a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this ring, as a protective layer of rime forms around you.

Isfjell. As a reaction to taking damage, or as a bonus action, you can spin the ring's jewel, causing it to expand into a hollow block of clear ice that completely surrounds you. This breaks any grapples in which you are involved and pushes any other creatures in your space out of it. The iceberg occupies your space and creatures can't pass through it, regardless of size. There is enough space within the iceberg to turn around, but you can't move more than 6 inches in any direction. Spells and other magical effects can't extend through the iceberg or be cast through it. While encased in ice, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to cease the jewel's spinning, causing the effect to end. The iceberg has 150 hit points, which takes as much of any triggering damage as possible. The iceberg can't regain hit points, has immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage, and has vulnerability to fire damage. Creatures that hit the iceberg with a melee attack take [[/r 3d8]] cold damage. The iceberg lasts up to 1 minute, until it is reduced to 0 hit points, or until you use a bonus action to cease the jewel's spinning. When it ends, you can choose to have it explode, launching sharp shards of ice at all creatures within 15 feet of you. Each creature must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking [[/r 3d8]] cold damage and [[/r 3d8]] piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once this property has been used, it can't be used again until the ring spends 8 continuous hours in snow, ice, or cold water.

Optional Attunement. If you attune to the ring, you gain resistance to cold damage while you wear it.

Allfather's Eye (Rare).name: Allfather's Eye (Rare)
Allfather's Eye (Rare).description:
Ring, rare (requires attunement)

When a stormsinger desires greater wisdom, they sacrifice their own eye and seek the Allfather's blessing. If their song is answered, the eye doesn't rot, and can be crafted into a ring or other adornment known as an allfather's eye.

Weapon, uncommon (requires attunement)

Martial weapon, ranged weapon 18 lb.
[[/r 1d10]] piercing - ammunition (100/400 ft.), heavy, loading, two-handed

Woven from the first branches to bloom at the end of winter, this living bow is strung with a length of snowspider's silk.

While holding this bow, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.SbSvZKkJASyk8jKo]{Druidcraft} cantrip. This light lasts for 1 minute after the arrow is shot from the bow.

Winter Hunt. This weapon deals an extra [[/r 1d4]] cold damage to each creature it hits that is in freezing temperatures or is standing on snow or ice.

Ice Shower. As an action, you can choose a point you can see within the normal range of this weapon and fire a volley of up to 6 arrows. These arrows levitate in the air when they enter a 10-foot radius centred on that point. For 1 minute, or until all the arrows are used, whenever a creature other than you enters the area for the first time on its turn or starts its turn there, one arrow shoots at it. The creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take [[/r 1d4]] piercing damage and [[/r 1d4]] cold damage. Once this property of the bow has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Range. A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. Loading a one-handed weapon requires a free hand. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

Heavy. Creatures that are Small or Tiny have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small or Tiny creature to use effectively.

Loading. Because of the time required to load this weapon, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

Two-Handed. This weapon requires two hands to use. This property is relevant only when you attack with the weapon, not when you simply hold it.

Snow Wolf Cowl (Uncommon).description:
Wondrous item, uncommon (requires attunement)

Those that do can have the head of such a monster enchanted by a clan shaman, granting them the power to transform into the beast. Weapon, rare

Martial weapon, melee weapon 4 lb.
[[/r 1d8]] slashing - versatile ([[/r 1d10]])

The Frozen Forge is the site of frost giants' cold forging secrets, a manufactory in the heart of a frigid volcano. As they hammer these ingots, they sing the Song of Steel, an ancient melody that prevents the cold, brittle metal from shearing beneath their mighty blows. By pressing the rune-engraved metal into one's skin, one creates a nigh-unbreakable bond with the Frozen Forge.

This axe has 5 charges and regains [[/r 1d4 + 1]] expended charges after it spends 8 continuous hours in snow, ice, or cold water. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to cause cold mist to emanate from the axe for 10 minutes. It glows a soft blue, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and deals an extra [[/r 1d8]] cold damage on a hit.

Enhanced Attunement: Brand. Over the course of an hour, you can undergo a branding ritual to become bonded to the axe, gaining access to the Razorice property. In addition, when the weapon regains charges, it regains all expended charges. Once you have undergone this branding ritual, you can't willingly end your attunement to the axe until another creature willingly undertakes the branding ritual, at which point it becomes attuned to the axe instead.

EA: Razorice. As an action, you can expend 2 charges to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.9gYGkrL6qFTsE6fw]{Spike Growth} spell (save DC 15), creating spikes of razor-sharp icicles that deal [[/r 3d4]] piercing damage for every 5 feet travelled instead of the spells normal damage.

Versatile. This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Branch of the Worldtree (Rare).name: Branch of the Worldtree (Rare)
Branch of the Worldtree (Rare).description:
Wand, rare (requires attunement)

Whether or not this branch truly came from the mythical Worldtree is unknown. However, it exudes potent, magical energy capable of manipulating plants and of great feats of healing. As it is used to channel a spell, the tips of its branches glow green-gold and the air is perfumed with the scent of mountain pines.

This wand can be used as a spellcasting focus for your druid or ranger spells and has 7 charges, represented by its seven green-gold leaves. When you expend a charge, a leaf withers and drifts to the ground. Each day at dawn, new leaf buds unfurl and the wand regains [[/r 1d6 + 1]] expended charges. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a [[/r d20]]. On a 1, the wand withers and petrifies, losing all magical properties.

Regrowth. The wand can enhance your healing spells. When you cast a spell that restores hit points and deals no damage while holding the wand, you can expend a number of charges equal to the spell's level to increase that level by 1. You can use this property only once per casting.

King of Plants. The wand has power over other plants. While holding the wand you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.SbSvZKkJASyk8jKo]{Druidcraft} cantrip at will. In addition, you can expend charges to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.YWtwzp6ZnQJMEmVW]{Plant Growth} (2 charges) and @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.DUBgwHPakcLDkB6W]{Tree Stride} (3 charges) spells.

If you accept the blessing, you gain access to the Fallen Brothers property. Once you accept the blessing, you can't willingly end your attunement to the blade until another creature kills a giant while wielding the weapon and chooses to accept the Allfather's blessing, at which point it becomes attuned to the sword instead.

Light. A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

Wand, very rare (requires attunement)

As it is used to channel a spell, the tips of its branches glow green-gold and the air is perfumed with the scent of mountain pines.

This wand can be used as a spellcasting focus for your druid or ranger spells and has 9 charges, represented by its seven green-gold leaves. When you expend a charge, a leaf withers and drifts to the ground. Each day at dawn, new leaf buds unfurl and the wand regains [[/r 1d6 + 3]] expended charges. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a [[/r d20]]. On a 1, the wand withers and petrifies, losing all magical properties.

Regrowth. The wand can enhance your healing spells. When you cast a spell that restores hit points and deals no damage while holding the wand, you can expend a number of charges equal to the spell's level to increase that level by 1. You can use this property only once per casting.

King of Plants. The wand has power over other plants. While holding the wand you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.SbSvZKkJASyk8jKo]{Druidcraft} cantrip at will. Simple weapon, melee weapon 2 lb.
[[/r 1d6]] slashing - light, thrown (20/60 ft.)

When the mighty wolf Fenrir threatened the world, the dwarves fashioned an impossibly strong thread with which to keep him bound. This thread, known as Gleipnir, was crafted from the sound of a cat's footfall, the roots of a mountain, and the breath of a fish, amongst other things. With the leftover material, the Weapons of Binding were made. The suneater axe is one such weapon, a depiction of the wolf Sköll, who the dwarves believe will one day devour the sun.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The axe has 6 charges and regains [[/r 1d6]] expended charges daily at dawn.

While holding this weapon, you have resistance to radiant damage.

Suneater. As an action, you can expend 2 charges to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness} spell. When you cast the spell in this way, you can choose to spend 1 additional charge. If you do, you can see through the magical darkness of the spell while holding the suneater axe.

Gleipnir. When you make an attack with this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to launch the axe's blade from the wolf's mouth, attached to the weapon by a long thread. Instead of a melee weapon attack, make a ranged weapon attack against a target within 30 feet of you, using your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects and it must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or become grappled (escape DC 16) as the thread wraps itself around it. A creature that fails this saving throw by 5 or more is restrained while it is grappled in this way. Huge or larger creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw. The grappled creature or a creature within reach of it can attempt a DC 16 Strength check, ending the grapple on a success. The grapple also ends if you pull the axe's blade back towards the weapon (no action required) or if you let go of the axe. While you have a creature grappled in this way, you can't attack with the suneater axe. As a bonus action, you can try to reel the creature in, making a Strength (Athletics) check, contested by one from the grappled creature. On a success, you pull the target up to 15 feet towards you.

If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the finesse property.

As they hammer these ingots, they sing the Song of Steel, an ancient melody that prevents the cold, brittle metal from shearing beneath their mighty blows. Those that do can have the head of such a monster enchanted by a clan shaman, granting them the power to transform into the beast. Brand. As an action, you can expend 2 charges to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.2yHXEcrRbadZDr5M]{Heat Metal} spell (save DC 13).

When the mighty wolf Fenrir threatened the world, the dwarves fashioned an impossibly strong thread with which to keep him bound. This thread, known as Gleipnir, was crafted from the sound of a cat's footfall, the roots of a mountain, and the breath of a fish, amongst other things. With the leftover material, the Weapons of Binding were made. The suneater axe is one such weapon, a depiction of the wolf Sköll, who the dwarves believe will one day devour the sun.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The axe has 6 charges and regains [[/r 1d6]] expended charges daily at dawn.

Suneater. As an action, you can expend 2 charges to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness} spell. When you cast the spell in this way, you can choose to spend 1 additional charge. If you do, you can see through the magical darkness of the spell while holding the suneater axe.

Gleipnir. When you make an attack with this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to launch the axe's blade from the wolf's mouth, attached to the weapon by a long thread. Instead of a melee weapon attack, make a ranged weapon attack against a target within 30 feet of you, using your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects and it must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or become grappled (escape DC 15) as the thread wraps itself around it. A creature that fails this saving throw by 5 or more is restrained while it is grappled in this way. Huge or larger creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw. The grappled creature or a creature within reach of it can attempt a DC 15 Strength check, ending the grapple on a success. The grapple also ends if you pull the axe's blade back towards the weapon (no action required) or if you let go of the axe. While you have a creature grappled in this way, you can't attack with the suneater axe. As a bonus action, you can try to reel the creature in, making a Strength (Athletics) check, contested by one from the grappled creature. On a success, you pull the target up to 15 feet towards you.

Versatile. This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

While holding this bow, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.SbSvZKkJASyk8jKo]{Druidcraft} cantrip. In addition, when an arrow is nocked on this bow, the arrow immediately lights up, emanating blue mist and shedding bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. This light lasts for 1 minute after the arrow is shot from the bow.

Winter Hunt. This weapon deals an extra [[/r 1d4]] cold damage to each creature it hits that is in freezing temperatures or is standing on snow or ice.

Ice Shower. As an action, you can choose a point you can see within the normal range of this weapon and fire a volley of up to 6 arrows. These arrows levitate in the air when they enter a 10-foot radius centred on that point. For 1 minute, or until all the arrows are used, whenever a creature other than you enters the area for the first time on its turn or starts its turn there, one arrow shoots at it. The creature must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take [[/r 1d4]] piercing damage and [[/r 1d4]] cold damage. Once this property of the bow has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Snow Wolf Cowl (Rare).description:

Wolf Form. As an action, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.04nMsTWkIFvkbXlY]{Polymorph} spell on yourself.   • You can speak Common, Giant, and Winter Wolf.

You can end this spell early at any time (no action required). Once this property of the cowl has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
